intro: Angostura magdalenensis, commonly known as the Magdalena angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
